Dear Nataliya Puga:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4166 Discharge plan
Section (1) When a resident is discharged from institutional care, all
Description of the following information shall be documented in the case
record within 14 days after discharge:
(a) The date of and reason for discharge, and the new
location of the child.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth did not have a complete discharge summary.
Investigation Interviews
I spoke to Complainant 1. There was no new information provided.
All interviews were conducted on 4/6/23 face to face at the facility.
I interviewed Clinical Director 1. Clinical Director 1 reported that
Youth A came into the facility on 3/27/23 and they removed her
from the program on 4/1/23. Youth A was exhibiting behaviors that
were aggressive and unsafe. Due to the behaviors, they contacted
911. The ambulance for Universal came on 4/1/23 and took her to
the hospital. Clinical Director 1 reported she left a voicemail to
Foster Care Worker 1 at 2:24pm letting her know that Youth A
needed a higher level of care and was discharged from the
program. Clinical Director 1 reported she stated in the voicemail
that the Foster Care Worker 1 would need to provider a “sitter” at
the hospital for Youth A.
I reviewed the Discharge Plan dated 4/1/23. The discharge plan
did not accurately state the location of Youth A. The location was
noted as the Hillsdale County DHHS Building.
Analysis The discharge plan did not note the hospital as the new location of
Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Established
2

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4166 Discharge plan
Section (1) When a resident is discharged from institutional care, all
Description of the following information shall be documented in the case
record within 14 days after discharge:
(e) A statement that the discharge plan recommendations,
including medical and dental follow up that is needed, have
been reviewed with the resident and with the parent and with
the responsible case manager.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth did not have a complete discharge summary.
Investigation I reviewed the discharge plan dated 4/1/23. It did not note that the
recommendations, including medical and dental, were followed up
and reviewed with the responsible case manager.
I Interviewed Foster Care Worker 1 on 4/6/23. Foster Care Worker
1 reported that she listened to a voicemail from the facility on
4/3/23 that Youth A had been sent to the hospital and that she
was discharged from the facility. Foster Care Worker 1 reported
the agency did not contact anyone else to make sure Youth A was
okay.
On 4/56/23, IR Clinical Director 1 reported that no one directly
spoke to Foster Care Worker 1 to go over their recommendations
and the follow up plan.
Analysis The agency discharged Youth A without discussing the
recommendations with the responsible case worker.
Conclusion Violation Established
3

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4166 Discharge plan
Section (1) When a resident is discharged from institutional care, all
Description of the following information shall be documented in the case
record within 14 days after discharge:
(f) The name and official title of the person to whom the
resident was discharged.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth did not have a complete discharge summary.
Investigation The Discharge Plan was reviewed. The Discharge Plan was
signed by the ambulance driver. The name is not legible, and the
agency did not know the name of the person that they released
Youth A to.
Analysis The name and official title of the person responsible for Youth A
was not documented on the Discharge Plan.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
